intro: Coelospermum monticola, commonly known as the mountain coelospermum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of mountainous regions. Coelospermum monticola is often found in cloud forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
